ygData.subject: Re: Guild- Qui H'oom Dai website-Singapore
ygData.msgSnippet: No lah. Officer sukah sukah can recruit or disband non officer members.
ygData.messageBody:
No lah. Officer sukah sukah can recruit or disband non officer members.

LKW wrote:

> From: LKW <leekw13@...>
>
> Alamak, sorry sorry, hehe. Didn't know EQ allow other than GM to recruit?
> But does it work like UO where it need the GM to do the final approval?
>
> I myself actually joined Qui H'oon Dai too, maybe 10 min b4 Garren joined
> too, hehe. But dunno bug or wat, my guild abbrev never shown up after I
> logoff that night. B4 I logout it was still there but now I cant see it
> anymore. Is there a command to show guild abbrev?
>
> On Thursday, June 24, 1999 6:12 PM, Gary Qui Hong Loong
> [SMTP:kanglun@...] wrote:
> > From: Gary Qui Hong Loong <kanglun@...>
> >
> > heheheh
> >
> > its the commands used to recruit
> >
> > is like target the guy, then type /recruit ???
> >
> > LKW wrote:
> >
> > > From: LKW <leekw13@...>
> > >
> > > Command simi member? I never command my members in UO after been a GM
> for
> > > more than 1.5 yrs leh. The only things I can relate to 'commanding' in
> EQ
> > > is the lower lvl kakis 'command' the higher lvl kakis to tank,
> hehehehe,
> > > see below:
> > >
> > > "Ooi, Yiyang, go tank leh"
> > > You see Yiyang fallen death.
> > > ^%$#^%$)*@ ask you tank you go act dead...ahhhhh...someone tank this
> thug
> > > for meeeeeeee...!"
> > > Zilus was slained by Thug.
> > > ^%$#^%$)*@
> > >
> > > You see Ziltus waiting outside Yiyang's house with a parang the next
> > > morning. LOL (j/k)
> > >
> > > On Thursday, June 24, 1999 5:55 PM, Gary Qui Hong Loong
> > > [SMTP:kanglun@...] wrote:
> > > > From: Gary Qui Hong Loong <kanglun@...>
> > > >
> > > > I'm alreadi an Officer. heheh but don't know what is the command
> to
> > > recruit
> > > > ppl. any1 can tell me how? heheh
> > > >
> > > > Alex wrote:
> > > >
> > > > > From: "Alex" <leealex@...>
> > > > >
> > > > > Sereph have an excellent idea there.
> > > > > Having an Officer will co-ordinate events and some PR stuff for us
> > > > > Singaporean.
> > > > > This will benefit not only us but the whole guild too.
> > > > > I however do not see a need to have a "spliting" of the guild. M
> aybe i
> > > > > understand diffrently. forgive me.
> > > > > With the exiting structure in Qui H'oom Dai, we only need to
> contribute
> > > and
> > > > > enchance it and not to "split" it to a Singapore typo.
> > > > > A "international" guild is much more attractive.
> > > > > With our diverse skills and resourses, im confident that we can
> help on
> > > the
> > > > > web pages, special events, etc.
> > > > > Now, we have another "loban" in Singularity.Thx to Sereph again.
> > > > >
> > > > > Concerning Officer, Im proposing the following ppl to be in:
> > > > > Sereph, Garren and Entreri .
> > > > > why? this ppl has the "fire", web knowhow and connections and most
> > > important
> > > > > of all....THEY play the game day and Nite! (get a life man :P )
> > > ..j/l\k
> > > > > Being avaiable is important , an officer need to be acessable.(and
> of
> > > > > course, we need to blame and hang someone when thing go wrong, they
> > > should
> > > > > be good bait for luring the Griffin too)
> > > > > wheather we have one officer or three, we leave that to the guild
> > > leaders
> > > > >
> > > > > Please lets have some further inputs on this , suggestions and
> ideas
> > > pls.
> > > > >
> > > > > -----Original Message-----
> > > > > From: Sereph <garford@...>
> > > > > To: <sg-everquest@onelist.com>
> > > > > Date: Wednesday, June 23, 1999 1:18 AM
> > > > > Subject: Re: [sg-everquest] Guild- Qui H'oom Dai website
> > > > >
> > > > > >From: Sereph <garford@...>
> > > > > >
> > > > > >I've got a proposition, mind asking the guild to set aside a
> seperate
> > > > > division
> > > > > >for us and appointing one of you guys who join earlier as an
> official?
> > > > > >
> > > > > >I ask this because if we all join in, the S'porean porpulation in
> > > there
> > > > > will
> > > > > >be quite huge and will grow furthur in the future. Spliting the
> guild
> > > into
> > > > > 2
> > > > > >can aid in co-ordinating events easier since we have this list in
> > > addition
> > > > > to
> > > > > >whatever form of communication they used and will make grouping
> easier
> > > too
> > > > > >
> > > > > >If this work out, I stop yakking the fact that WE NEED A CLERIC!!!
> > > > > >
